titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Stefan Jędrychowski papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Michael Herrick

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-04-13T09:37-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Interview transcripts, speeches and writings, correspondence, and photographs relating to governmental administration, economic planning, and foreign policy in Poland.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Stefan Jędrychowski papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1995.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Stefan Jędrychowski (1910-1996) was a Polish economist and politician who served in many high-ranking offices of the Polish People's Republic. He joined the communist party in Wilno, where he was born and educated, before World War II, becoming a member of the Soviet Communist Party during the war. In the 1940s, Jędrychowski was a member of the Polish Committee of National Liberation (PKWN), representing the committee in Moscow and France and then serving in the national unity government as the Minister of Navigation and Foreign Trade. In Poland he served as the vice president of the Rada Ministrów from 1951 to 1956; president of the Komisja Planowania from 1956 to 1968; Minister of Foreign Affairs from 1968 to 1971; and Minister of Finance from 1971 to 1974. He was also a member of the Central Committee of the Polish United Workers' Party in the 1950s and 1960s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers of Stefan Jędrychowski consist of interview transcripts, speeches and writings, correspondence, and photographs relating to governmental administration, economic planning, and foreign policy in Poland. The collection is divided into two series, both arranged chronologically. The documentary and photographic evidence which Jędrychowski preserved about his governmental activity in communist Poland provides a window into the highest levels of party life during the post-war decades and Poland's place in the orbit of communist states.

The Speeches, Interviews, and Writings series, containing speeches, interviews, planning documents and other writings by Jędrychowski, is strongest in the earliest period of his political and governmental activity during the late 1940s and early 1950s. The transcript of an extensive interview of Jędrychowski conducted in the early 1990s is at the end of this series and forms a useful guide to the original documents.

The Photographs series reflect the full range of Jędrychowski's public life from the 1940s into the 1980s. Nearly all were produced by professional, official government photographers and primarily document Jędrychowski's participation in official visits, ceremonies, and meetings in Poland and abroad as a representative of the Polish government. This part of the collection is richest, therefore, from the mid-1950s to the early 1970s. Frequently Jędrychowski is not the main participant in an event, being a listener or observer of the primary participant or action. He annotated extensively on the back of most of the photographs. The descriptions in this finding aid are summaries that will help guide researchers to particular photographs or year ranges, but they are not exhaustive in terms of what a researcher will be able to identify about a photograph when consulting it, nor is it an exhaustive, photograph-by-photograph, register.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The speeches, drafts of articles and other writings, and planning documents from the 1940s are originals for which Jędrychowski created a complete numbered title inventory. Beginning in 1950, the documents are primarily photocopies of his original manuscripts and typescripts. These photocopies have a new numbering system, but this range of numbers is not complete and no title inventory was supplied by Jędrychowski. Original documents and extensive photocopies from originals have been described at the folder level using Jędrychowski’s own Polish title or an English summary title of contents. Smaller, and non-original documents, are arranged chronologically. Like the earlier range of documents from the late 1940s, which have full title access in the Scope and Contents notes of each folder, these are planning notes, drafts of speeches, articles, and other writings which Jędrychowski created in the early 1950s.

When a numbered inventory had been made by Jędrychowski, this system is kept, so that there are a few documents which are in effect his memories about the late 1940s and 1950s, produced in the 1980s, which are filed alongside the documents of the period itself. The early 1990s interviews looking back over his entire career, however, relate to all events and writings of his professional life, so they are filed at the time of their creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1) Z problematyki handlu zagranicznego. (IX 1946); 2) Tezy do referatu o organizacji handlu zagranicznego. (IX 1946); 3) (X 1946); 4) Na drodze do polskiego eksportu. (I 1946); 5) Przemowienie na Zjezdzie Kierownikow Placowek Zagranicznych Ministerstwa Zeglugi i handlu Zagranicznego dotyczace strategii gospodarczej. (XII 1946); 6) Nowa Umowa handlowa polsko-radziecka o wymianie gospodarczej. (1946); 7) Przemowienie wygloszone na posiedzeniu z dyrektorem generalnym UNRRA. (1946); 8) Tezy o polityce handlu zagranicznego. (1946); 9) Wybory 1946. Strategia polityczna. (I 1946).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 10) Na drodze rozwoju polskiego handlu zagranicznego. (1947); 11) Przemowienie na plenarnym posiedzeniu KC PPR o strategii gospodarczej. ( 13-14. IV .1947); 12) Angielska droga do socjalizmu, czy kapitalizm panstwowy. (1947); 13) Przemowienie wygloszone na zjezdzie Zwiazku Walki Mlodych o pakcie o wspolpracy i jednosci dzialania PPR i PPS. (1948); 14) O znaczeniu niektorych roznic w ocenie biezacej polityki gospodarczej. (Artykul do "Nowych Drog" Nr.4, VII 1947).

scopecontent.head: Scope and contents note
scopecontent.p: 15) Zmiany w swiecie imperialistycznym. (XII 1947); 16) O imperializmie. (XII 1947); 17) Walka o wolnosc nauki, czy o utrzymanie starego porzadku; 18) Notatka informacyjna o sprawie propagandy anglosaskiej. (1947); 19) Przemowienie na Zjezdzie Zw. Zaw. Wlokniarzy. (XI 1947).

scopecontent.head: Scope and contents note
scopecontent.p: 20) Przemowienie na rocznice Rewolucji Pazdziernikowej. (XI 1947); 21) Przemowienie na swieto Narodowe 22 Lipca o dokonaniach PKWN. (VII 1947); 22) Odczyt mowy na temat sytuacji Polski na miedzynarodowej arenie politycznej (VII 1947); 23) Przemowienie na plenum Sejmu referujace ustawe o planie odbudowy gospodarczej. (VII 1947); 25) Referat na Komisje Planu Gospodarczego - Rolnictwo. (VII 1947).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 26) Analiza porownawcza komunistycznego i kapitalistycznego powojennego rozwoju gospodarczego. (Jesien 1947); 27) Przemowienie w Sejmie - Dyskusja nad budzetem. (VII 1947); 28) Referat w Sejmie o budzecie na rok 1948.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 29) Wytyczne dla przemowien w dniu Swieta Ludowego. (1947); 30) Polityka morska szerokiego oddechu. Artykul opublikowany w "Glosie Ludu". (VI 1946); 31) Na drodze rozwoju polskiego handlu zagranicznego. (Artykul opublikowany w "Trybunie Wolnosci• Nr.2 II 1947); 32) Historia odrodzenia demokratycznego panstwa polskiego. (I 1947); 33) Plan odbudowy gospodarczej. Artykul opublikowany w "Nowych Drogach". (Nr. 1, I 1947); 34) Niedzwiedzia przysluga. Krytyka emigracyjnego rzadu Mikolajczyka. Artykul opublikowany w "Glosie Ludu". (III 1945); 35) Przemowienie w Sejmie o przyjazni polsko-czechoslowackiej. (IV 1947); 36) Sprawy gospodarcze. Niektore zagadnienia gospodarki polskiej. (VII 1947).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 37) Dochod narodowy Polski w 1947 r. (1948); 38) Inwestycje na wybrzezu morskim w latach 1946 - 1948. (1948); 39) Zjednoczenie PPR i PPS. Problematyka zwiazkowa. (Relacja nagrana w KC PZPR 10 V 1988); 40) Glowne roznice zdan pomiedzy PPR a PPS. (Relacja nagrana w CA Kc PZPR 12 IV 1988); 41) Zjednoczenie PPR i PPS. (Relacja nagrana w CA KC PZP 12 IV 1988); 42) Wlochy w przededniu wyborow. (1988); 43) Obchody Rocznicy Rewolucji 1848. Artykul opublikowany w Articles et Documents. (1948); 44) Przemowa wygloszona na akademii z okazji setnej rocznicy Rewolucji Wegierskiej 1848 roku. (14.III.1948); 45) Przemowienie wygloszone na plenum Sejmu o ustawie o Narodowym Planie Gospodarczym nas rok 1948. (9 III 1948).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 46) Przemowienie wygloszone w trzecia rocznice smierci Franklina D. Roosevelta (12.IV.1948); 47) Planowanie gospodarcze jako zasada polskie'j gospodarki narodowej. Referat wygloszony na kursie planowania Centralnego Zwiazku Spoldzielczego w Otwocku. (21.VI.1948); 48) Planowanie w rybolostwie morskim. Referat wygloszony na naradzie rybackiej w Kolobrzegu. (VIII 1948); 49) Plan Marshalla. Artykul opublikowany w "Nowych Drogach." (IX 1948); 50) Referat o sytuacji gospodarczej kraju. (9.XI.1947); 51) Kryzys w kierownictwie PPR w 1948 roku. (16.III.1983).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 52) Przemowienie w Sejmie dotyczace dekretu o arbitrazu. (Jesien 1949); 53) Sprawozdanie z zebrania aktywu powiatowego powiatu radomskiego 20.11.1949 na temat uchwal III Plenum KC PZPR; 54) Sprawozdanie z narady partyjnego aktywu wiejskiego w powiecie gdanskim. (30.X.1949); 55) Artykul dla Trybuny Ludu dotyczacy polityki ekonomicznej. (XI.1949); 56) Sprawozdanie z zebrania organizacji podstawowych kolejarskich stacji Warszawa Zachodnia w warsztatach kolejowych w Szczeeliwicach w dniu 21.XI.1949, na temat uchwal III Plenum KC PZPR; 57) Referat na rocznice Rewolucji Pazdziernikowej. (5.XI.49); 58) Przemawianie wygloszone na Naradzie Oszczednosciowej w kwietniu 1949; 59) Niektore elementy wtornego podzialu dochodu narodowego w Polsce. Artykul "za Procznyj Mir i Narodnuju Demokracju." (1949).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 60) Referat o postepie technicznym w ramach planu szescioletniego i rozwoju szkolnictwa wyzszego. (1950); 61) Osiagniecia gospodarcze Polski Ludowej i reforma pieniezna. (XI 1950); 62) O planowaniu gospodarczym w terenie. Stenogram wykladu wygloszonego na kursie Sekretarzy Komitetow Powiatowych. (VII 1950); 63) Socjalistyczne planowanie i jego znaczenie polityczne. Referat Ministra Jedrychowskiego. (16.XI.1950); 64) Plan szescioletni. (1950); 65) Przemowienie w Sejmie na temat planu szkolenia zawodowego. (4.II.1950); unnumbered speech on Czechoslovakia and Poland relations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Participants include Władysław Gomułka, Józef Cyrankiewicz, Zenon Kliszko, Stefan Jędrychowski, L. I. Brezniew (Л. И. Брежнев), K. T. Mazurow (К. Т. Мазуров), J. W. Andropow (Ю. В. Андропов), W. N. Nowikow (В. Н. Новиков), P. M. Maszerow (П. М. Машеров), W. I. Kozłow (В.И. Козлов), T. D. Kisielew.

did.unittitle: Typescript of interview of S. Jędrychowski by Grzegorz Sołtysiak, part 1,
Typescript of interview of S. Jędrychowski by Grzegorz Sołtysiak, part 2,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Nearly all photographs involve Jędrychowski as a participant in an official visit, social gathering, speech, tour, etc., often with foreign dignitaries. Based on the collection, it can be assumed that most of the images of factories, construction projects, etc. in which he does not appear are related to his personal visits in an official capacity or some aspect of his work in economic planning in Poland. Jędrychowski has made annotations on the back of nearly all of the photos, which seem to have mostly been taken by professional, official photographers. The scope and content notes accompanying each year are not exhaustive and represent a brief summary of the contents of each envelope. The verso of each photograph should be consulted for more detailed information. In the summary descriptions of each year when a subject is left out, such as “in conversation with X,” it can be assumed that it is Jędrychowski in conversation with X. However, in many of the official visit photographs Jędrychowski appears as a fellow marcher, listener, or observer of a signing and not as the main participant.
There has been some water damage to the photographs in this collection

The photographs have been arranged in three subseries by size: 7 x 5-inch photographs are arranged chronologically in Small photographs; photographs up to 12 x 8.5 inches are arranged chronologically in Large photographs; the largest items are stored in a flat box and in the subseries Oversize photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Multiple photographs pasted to a large exhibit-worthy sheet showing optical equipment on exhibit in Warsaw in 1960 early May; mounted, exhibit-worthy handwritten record of civil engineering and industrial development accomplishments in Łodż since 1950, dated in blue ink 1963 November 3; visit to steelworks Italsider-Taranto in 1966 June; receiving award from Soviet Ambassador Aristow, 1967 November 6; meeting with Janos Kadar and t. Łukaszewicz, 1976 July 28.
